page.title: 02Local Sayings.
page.content: 1.A wet May brings plenty of corn and hay. 2.If the wind is in the East on March 16th. it will stay there for the full quarter. 3.If you cut thistles in May they'll be back right away. 4.If you cut thistles in July they'll be sure to die. 5.The oak before the ash there's sure to be a splash.The ash before the oak there's sure to be a soak. 6.Red sky at night shepherd's delight. Red sky at morning shepherd's warning. 7.Cold wet May _full bay. 8.For the itch and the stitch,the rheumatic and the gout,if the devil isn't in you, the well will take it out! 9.A fish wouldn't get into trouble if he kept his mouth shut. 10.On Feb.14th.every goose should lay.
